name: ISO/IEC 27002:2022
description: Information security, cybersecurity and privacy protection - Information security controls

requirements.title: Policies for information security
requirements.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies should be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.
requirements.description_long: An information security policy and topic-specific policies should be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur. The purpose is to provide management direction and support for information security in accordance with business requirements and relevant laws and regulations.

requirements.title: Information security roles and responsibilities
requirements.description: Information security roles and responsibilities should be defined and allocated according to the organization needs.
requirements.description_long: Information security roles and responsibilities should be defined and allocated according to the organization needs. The purpose is to establish a defined, approved and understood structure for the implementation, operation and management of information security within the organization.

requirements.title: Segregation of duties
requirements.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility should be segregated.
requirements.description_long: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility should be segregated. The purpose is to reduce the risk of fraud, error and bypassing of information security controls.

requirements.title: Management responsibilities
requirements.description: Management should require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.
requirements.description_long: Management should require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization. The purpose is to ensure management understands their role in information security and undertakes actions aiming to ensure all personnel are aware of and fulfil their information security responsibilities.

requirements.title: Contact with authorities
requirements.description: The organization should establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.
requirements.description_long: The organization should establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities. The purpose is to ensure appropriate flow of information takes place with respect to information security between the organization and relevant legal, regulatory and supervisory authorities.

requirements.title: Contact with special interest groups
requirements.description: The organization should establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.
requirements.description_long: The organization should establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations. The purpose is to ensure appropriate flow of information takes place with respect to information security.

requirements.title: Threat intelligence
requirements.description: Information relating to information security threats should be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.
requirements.description_long: Information relating to information security threats should be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence. The purpose is to provide awareness of the organization's threat environment so that the appropriate mitigation actions can be taken.

requirements.title: Information security in project management
requirements.description: Information security should be integrated into project management.
requirements.description_long: Information security should be integrated into project management. The purpose is to ensure information security risks related to projects and deliverables are effectively addressed in project management throughout the project life cycle.

requirements.title: Inventory of information and other associated assets
requirements.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, should be developed and maintained.
requirements.description_long: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, should be developed and maintained. The purpose is to identify the organization's information and other associated assets in order to preserve their information security and assign appropriate ownership.

requirements.title: Acceptable use of information and other associated assets
requirements.description: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets should be identified, documented and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets should be identified, documented and implemented. The purpose is to ensure information and other associated assets are appropriately protected, used and handled.

requirements.title: Return of assets
requirements.description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate should return all the organization's assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement.
requirements.description_long: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate should return all the organization's assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement. The purpose is to protect the organization's assets as part of the process of changing or terminating employment, contract or agreement.

requirements.title: Classification of information
requirements.description: Information should be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.
requirements.description_long: Information should be classified according to the information security needs of the organization based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements. The purpose is to ensure identification and understanding of protection needs of information in accordance with its importance to the organization.

requirements.title: Labelling of information
requirements.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling should be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization.
requirements.description_long: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling should be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organization. The purpose is to facilitate communication of classification of information and support automation of information processing and management.

requirements.title: Information transfer
requirements.description: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements should be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties.
requirements.description_long: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements should be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organization and between the organization and other parties. The purpose is to maintain the security of information transferred within an organization and with any external interested party.

requirements.title: Access control
requirements.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets should be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements.
requirements.description_long: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets should be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements. The purpose is to ensure authorized access and to prevent unauthorized access to information and other associated assets.

requirements.title: Identity management
requirements.description: The full life cycle of identities should be managed.
requirements.description_long: The full life cycle of identities should be managed. The purpose is to allow for the unique identification of individuals and systems accessing the organization's information and other associated assets and to enable appropriate assignment of access rights.

requirements.title: Authentication information
requirements.description: Allocation and management of authentication information should be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information.
requirements.description_long: Allocation and management of authentication information should be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on appropriate handling of authentication information. The purpose is to ensure proper entity authentication and prevent failures of authentication processes.

requirements.title: Access rights
requirements.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets should be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.
requirements.description_long: Access rights to information and other associated assets should be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on and rules for access control. The purpose is to ensure access to information and other associated assets is defined and authorized according to business requirements.

requirements.title: Information security in supplier relationships
requirements.description: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services.
requirements.description_long: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier's products or services. The purpose is to maintain an agreed level of information security in supplier relationships.

requirements.title: Addressing information security within supplier agreements
requirements.description: Relevant information security requirements should be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.
requirements.description_long: Relevant information security requirements should be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship. The purpose is to maintain an agreed level of information security in supplier relationships.

requirements.title: Managing information security in the ICT supply chain
requirements.description: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.
requirements.description_long: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain. The purpose is to maintain an agreed level of information security in supplier relationships.

requirements.title: Monitoring, review and change management of supplier services
requirements.description: The organization should regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.
requirements.description_long: The organization should regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery. The purpose is to maintain an agreed level of information security and service delivery in line with supplier agreements.

requirements.title: Information security for use of cloud services
requirements.description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services should be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements.
requirements.description_long: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services should be established in accordance with the organization's information security requirements. The purpose is to specify and manage information security for the use of cloud services.

requirements.title: Information security incident management planning and preparation
requirements.description: The organization should plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.
requirements.description_long: The organization should plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities. The purpose is to ensure quick, effective, consistent and orderly response to information security incidents, including communication on information security events.

requirements.title: Assessment and decision on information security events
requirements.description: The organization should assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents.
requirements.description_long: The organization should assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorized as information security incidents. The purpose is to ensure effective categorization and prioritization of information security events.

requirements.title: Response to information security incidents
requirements.description: Information security incidents should be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.
requirements.description_long: Information security incidents should be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures. The purpose is to ensure efficient and effective response to information security incidents.

requirements.title: Learning from information security incidents
requirements.description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents should be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.
requirements.description_long: Knowledge gained from information security incidents should be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls. The purpose is to reduce the likelihood or impact of future incidents.

requirements.title: Collection of evidence
requirements.description: The organization should establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.
requirements.description_long: The organization should establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events. The purpose is to ensure consistent and effective management of evidence related to information security events for the purposes of disciplinary and legal actions.

requirements.title: Information security during disruption
requirements.description: The organization should plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.
requirements.description_long: The organization should plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption. The purpose is to protect information and other associated assets during disruption.

requirements.title: ICT readiness for business continuity
requirements.description: ICT readiness should be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.
requirements.description_long: ICT readiness should be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements. The purpose is to ensure the availability of the organization's information and other associated assets during disruption.

requirements.title: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
requirements.description: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization's approach to meet these requirements should be identified, documented and kept up to date.
requirements.description_long: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organization's approach to meet these requirements should be identified, documented and kept up to date. The purpose is to ensure compliance with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements related to information security.

requirements.title: Intellectual property rights
requirements.description: The organization should implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.
requirements.description_long: The organization should implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights. The purpose is to ensure compliance with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements related to intellectual property rights and use of proprietary products.

requirements.title: Protection of records
requirements.description: Records should be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release.
requirements.description_long: Records should be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorized access and unauthorized release. The purpose is to ensure compliance with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements, as well as community or societal expectations related to the protection and availability of records.

requirements.title: Privacy and protection of PII
requirements.description: The organization should identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.
requirements.description_long: The organization should identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements. The purpose is to ensure compliance with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements related to the information security aspects of the protection of PII.

requirements.title: Independent review of information security
requirements.description: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies should be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.
requirements.description_long: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies should be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur. The purpose is to ensure the continuing suitability, adequacy and effectiveness of the organization's approach to managing information security.

requirements.title: Compliance with policies, rules and standards for information security
requirements.description: Compliance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards should be regularly reviewed.
requirements.description_long: Compliance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards should be regularly reviewed. The purpose is to ensure that information security is implemented and operated in accordance with the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards.

requirements.title: Documented operating procedures
requirements.description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities should be documented and made available to personnel who need them.
requirements.description_long: Operating procedures for information processing facilities should be documented and made available to personnel who need them. The purpose is to ensure the correct and secure operation of information processing facilities.

requirements.title: Screening
requirements.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel should be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.
requirements.description_long: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel should be carried out prior to joining the organization and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks. The purpose is to ensure that all personnel are eligible and suitable for the roles for which they are considered and remain eligible and suitable during their employment.

requirements.title: Terms and conditions of employment
requirements.description: The employment contractual agreements should state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security.
requirements.description_long: The employment contractual agreements should state the personnel's and the organization's responsibilities for information security. The purpose is to ensure personnel understand their information security responsibilities for the roles for which they are considered.

requirements.title: Information security awareness, education and training
requirements.description: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties should receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.
requirements.description_long: Personnel of the organization and relevant interested parties should receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organization's information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function. The purpose is to ensure personnel and relevant interested parties are aware of and fulfil their information security responsibilities.

requirements.title: Disciplinary process
requirements.description: A disciplinary process should be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.
requirements.description_long: A disciplinary process should be formalized and communicated to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation. The purpose is to ensure personnel and other relevant interested parties understand the consequences of information security policy violation, to deter and appropriately deal with personnel and other relevant interested parties who committed the violation.

requirements.title: Responsibilities after termination or change of employment
requirements.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment should be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.
requirements.description_long: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment should be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties. The purpose is to protect the organization's interests as part of the process of changing or terminating employment or contracts.

requirements.title: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements
requirements.description: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information should be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties.
requirements.description_long: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information should be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties. The purpose is to maintain confidentiality of information accessible by personnel or external parties.

requirements.title: Remote working
requirements.description: Security measures should be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organization's premises.
requirements.description_long: Security measures should be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organization's premises. The purpose is to ensure the security of information when personnel are working remotely.

requirements.title: Information security event reporting
requirements.description: The organization should provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.
requirements.description_long: The organization should provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner. The purpose is to support timely, consistent and effective reporting of information security events that can be identified by personnel.

requirements.title: Physical security perimeters
requirements.description: Security perimeters should be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets.
requirements.description_long: Security perimeters should be defined and used to protect areas that contain information and other associated assets. The purpose is to prevent unauthorized physical access, damage and interference to the organization's information and other associated assets.

requirements.title: Physical entry
requirements.description: Secure areas should be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.
requirements.description_long: Secure areas should be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points. The purpose is to ensure only authorized physical access to the organization's information and other associated assets occurs.

requirements.title: Securing offices, rooms and facilities
requirements.description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities should be designed and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities should be designed and implemented. The purpose is to prevent unauthorized physical access, damage and interference to the organization's information and other associated assets in offices, rooms and facilities.

requirements.title: Physical security monitoring
requirements.description: Premises should be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access.
requirements.description_long: Premises should be continuously monitored for unauthorized physical access. The purpose is to detect and deter unauthorized physical access.

requirements.title: Protecting against physical and environmental threats
requirements.description: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure should be designed and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure should be designed and implemented. The purpose is to prevent or reduce the consequences of events originating from physical and environmental threats.

requirements.title: Working in secure areas
requirements.description: Security measures for working in secure areas should be designed and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Security measures for working in secure areas should be designed and implemented. The purpose is to protect information and other associated assets in secure areas from damage and unauthorized interference by personnel working in these areas.

requirements.title: Clear desk and clear screen
requirements.description: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities should be defined and appropriately enforced.
requirements.description_long: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities should be defined and appropriately enforced. The purpose is to reduce the risks of unauthorized access, loss of and damage to information on desks, screens and in other accessible locations during and outside normal working hours.

requirements.title: Equipment siting and protection
requirements.description: Equipment should be sited securely and protected.
requirements.description_long: Equipment should be sited securely and protected. The purpose is to reduce the risks from physical and environmental threats, and from unauthorized access and damage.

requirements.title: Security of assets off-premises
requirements.description: Off-site assets should be protected.
requirements.description_long: Off-site assets should be protected. The purpose is to prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise of off-site devices and interruption to the organization's operations.

requirements.title: Storage media
requirements.description: Storage media should be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme and handling requirements.
requirements.description_long: Storage media should be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organization's classification scheme and handling requirements. The purpose is to ensure only authorized disclosure, modification, removal or destruction of information on storage media.

requirements.title: Supporting utilities
requirements.description: Information processing facilities should be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.
requirements.description_long: Information processing facilities should be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities. The purpose is to prevent loss, damage or compromise of information and other associated assets, or interruption to the organization's operations due to the failure and disruption of supporting utilities.

requirements.title: Cabling security
requirements.description: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services should be protected from interception, interference or damage.
requirements.description_long: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services should be protected from interception, interference or damage. The purpose is to prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise of information and other associated assets and interruption to the organization's operations related to power and communications cabling.

requirements.title: Equipment maintenance
requirements.description: Equipment should be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and confidentiality of information.
requirements.description_long: Equipment should be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and confidentiality of information. The purpose is to prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise of information and other associated assets and interruption to the organization's operations caused by lack of maintenance.

requirements.title: Secure disposal or re-use of equipment
requirements.description: Items of equipment containing storage media should be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.
requirements.description_long: Items of equipment containing storage media should be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use. The purpose is to prevent leakage of information from equipment to be disposed or re-used.

requirements.title: User endpoint devices
requirements.description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices should be protected.
requirements.description_long: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices should be protected. The purpose is to protect information against the risks introduced by using user endpoint devices.

requirements.title: Privileged access rights
requirements.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights should be restricted and managed.
requirements.description_long: The allocation and use of privileged access rights should be restricted and managed. The purpose is to ensure only authorized users, software components and services are provided with privileged access rights.

requirements.title: Information access restriction
requirements.description: Access to information and other associated assets should be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.
requirements.description_long: Access to information and other associated assets should be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control. The purpose is to ensure only authorized access and to prevent unauthorized access to information and other associated assets.

requirements.title: Access to source code
requirements.description: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries should be appropriately managed.
requirements.description_long: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries should be appropriately managed. The purpose is to prevent the introduction of unauthorized functionality, avoid unintentional or malicious changes and to maintain the confidentiality of valuable intellectual property.

requirements.title: Secure authentication
requirements.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures should be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.
requirements.description_long: Secure authentication technologies and procedures should be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control. The purpose is to ensure a user or an entity is securely authenticated when access to systems, applications and services is granted.

requirements.title: Capacity management
requirements.description: The use of resources should be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.
requirements.description_long: The use of resources should be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements. The purpose is to ensure the required capacity of information processing facilities, human resources, offices and other facilities.

requirements.title: Protection against malware
requirements.description: Protection against malware should be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.
requirements.description_long: Protection against malware should be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness. The purpose is to ensure information and other associated assets are protected against malware.

requirements.title: Management of technical vulnerabilities
requirements.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use should be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities should be evaluated and appropriate measures should be taken.
requirements.description_long: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use should be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities should be evaluated and appropriate measures should be taken. The purpose is to prevent exploitation of technical vulnerabilities.

requirements.title: Configuration management
requirements.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks should be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.
requirements.description_long: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks should be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed. The purpose is to ensure hardware, software, services and networks function correctly with required security settings, and configuration is not altered by unauthorized or incorrect changes.

requirements.title: Information deletion
requirements.description: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media should be deleted when no longer required.
requirements.description_long: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media should be deleted when no longer required. The purpose is to prevent unnecessary exposure of sensitive information and to comply with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements for information deletion.

requirements.title: Data masking
requirements.description: Data masking should be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.
requirements.description_long: Data masking should be used in accordance with the organization's topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration. The purpose is to limit the exposure of sensitive data including PII, and to comply with legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements.

requirements.title: Data leakage prevention
requirements.description: Data leakage prevention measures should be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.
requirements.description_long: Data leakage prevention measures should be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information. The purpose is to detect and prevent the unauthorized disclosure and extraction of information by individuals or systems.

requirements.title: Information backup
requirements.description: Backup copies of information, software and systems should be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.
requirements.description_long: Backup copies of information, software and systems should be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup. The purpose is to enable recovery from loss of data or systems.

requirements.title: Redundancy of information processing facilities
requirements.description: Information processing facilities should be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements.
requirements.description_long: Information processing facilities should be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability requirements. The purpose is to ensure the continuous operation of information processing facilities.

requirements.title: Logging
requirements.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events should be produced, stored, protected and analysed.
requirements.description_long: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events should be produced, stored, protected and analysed. The purpose is to record events, generate evidence, ensure the integrity of log information, prevent against unauthorized access, identify information security events that can lead to an information security incident and to support investigations.

requirements.title: Monitoring activities
requirements.description: Networks, systems and applications should be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.
requirements.description_long: Networks, systems and applications should be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents. The purpose is to detect anomalous behaviour and potential information security incidents.

requirements.title: Clock synchronization
requirements.description: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organization should be synchronized to approved time sources.
requirements.description_long: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organization should be synchronized to approved time sources. The purpose is to enable the correlation and analysis of security-related events and other recorded data, and to support investigations into information security incidents.

requirements.title: Use of privileged utility programs
requirements.description: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding system and application controls should be restricted and tightly controlled.
requirements.description_long: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding system and application controls should be restricted and tightly controlled. The purpose is to ensure the use of utility programs does not harm system and application controls.

requirements.title: Installation of software on operational systems
requirements.description: Procedures and measures should be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.
requirements.description_long: Procedures and measures should be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems. The purpose is to ensure the integrity of operational systems and prevent exploitation of technical vulnerabilities.

requirements.title: Networks security
requirements.description: Networks and network devices should be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.
requirements.description_long: Networks and network devices should be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications. The purpose is to protect information in networks and its supporting information processing facilities from compromise via the network.

requirements.title: Security of network services
requirements.description: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services should be identified, implemented and monitored.
requirements.description_long: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services should be identified, implemented and monitored. The purpose is to ensure security in the use of network services.

requirements.title: Segregation of networks
requirements.description: Groups of information services, users and information systems should be segregated in the organization's networks.
requirements.description_long: Groups of information services, users and information systems should be segregated in the organization's networks. The purpose is to split the network into security boundaries and control traffic between them based on business needs.

requirements.title: Web filtering
requirements.description: Access to external websites should be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.
requirements.description_long: Access to external websites should be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content. The purpose is to protect systems from being compromised by malware and to prevent access to unauthorized web resources.

requirements.title: Use of cryptography
requirements.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, should be defined and implemented.
requirements.description_long: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, should be defined and implemented. The purpose is to ensure proper and effective use of cryptography to protect the confidentiality, authenticity or integrity of information according to business and information security requirements, and taking into consideration legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements related to cryptography.

requirements.title: Secure development life cycle
requirements.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems should be established and applied.
requirements.description_long: Rules for the secure development of software and systems should be established and applied. The purpose is to ensure information security is designed and implemented within the secure development life cycle of software and systems.

requirements.title: Application security requirements
requirements.description: Information security requirements should be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications.
requirements.description_long: Information security requirements should be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications. The purpose is to ensure all information security requirements are identified and addressed when developing or acquiring applications.

requirements.title: Secure system architecture and engineering principles
requirements.description: Principles for engineering secure systems should be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities.
requirements.description_long: Principles for engineering secure systems should be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities. The purpose is to ensure information systems are securely designed, implemented and operated within the development life cycle.

requirements.title: Secure coding
requirements.description: Secure coding principles should be applied to software development.
requirements.description_long: Secure coding principles should be applied to software development. The purpose is to ensure software is written securely thereby reducing the number of potential information security vulnerabilities in the software.

requirements.title: Security testing in development and acceptance
requirements.description: Security testing processes should be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.
requirements.description_long: Security testing processes should be defined and implemented in the development life cycle. The purpose is to validate if information security requirements are met when applications or code are deployed to the production environment.

requirements.title: Outsourced development
requirements.description: The organization should direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development.
requirements.description_long: The organization should direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development. The purpose is to ensure information security measures required by the organization are implemented in outsourced system development.

requirements.title: Separation of development, test and production environments
requirements.description: Development, testing and production environments should be separated and secured.
requirements.description_long: Development, testing and production environments should be separated and secured. The purpose is to reduce the risks of unauthorized access or changes to the production environment.

requirements.title: Change management
requirements.description: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems should be subject to change management procedures.
requirements.description_long: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems should be subject to change management procedures. The purpose is to preserve information security when executing changes.

requirements.title: Test information
requirements.description: Test information should be appropriately selected, protected and managed.
requirements.description_long: Test information should be appropriately selected, protected and managed. The purpose is to ensure relevance of testing and protection of operational information used for testing.

requirements.title: Protection of information systems during audit testing
requirements.description: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems should be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.
requirements.description_long: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems should be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management. The purpose is to minimize the impact of audit and other assurance activities on operational systems and business processes.
